Title: S7 Ep. 316 Paige Dansinger – Pioneering Art, Technology, and Community Building in the Metaverse
Description:
In this episode of The Intern Whisperer Podcast, we’re joined by Paige Dansinger, a visionary leader at the intersection of art, technology, and community building. Paige is the founder of the Better World Museum, Horizon Art Museum, and Women in Horizon. She’s a renowned speaker in XR (Extended Reality), with over a decade of pioneering work in virtual reality (VR), augmented reality (AR), artificial intelligence (AI), and community empowerment.

 

Paige’s journey is nothing short of inspiring. From her early days as an artist to her innovative work in the metaverse, she’s used immersive technology to foster inclusion, resilience, and storytelling in diverse communities. She shares how she transitioned from art school to the world of immersive tech, creating interactive experiences like the Museum Draw project at the Guggenheim and launching the Better World Museum, a space that brought together technology and social impact.

 

We dive into her current work in Horizon Worlds and how she’s using VR and AR to create spaces for social change, empowerment, and art. Paige talks about the concept of “edible corridors” for future cities, how fashion and wearables are pushing boundaries in virtual worlds, and the role of AI in our lives. She also reflects on how play and creativity can help tackle global challenges like climate change.

 

This episode is full of incredible insights into how art and technology can come together to create a better, more inclusive world.

Key Takeaways:

  • Paige’s innovative approach to blending art and technology in immersive spaces.
  • The impact of the Better World Museum and Horizon Art Museum on community empowerment.
  • How VR and AR are shaping the future of art, storytelling, and social change.
  • Paige’s vision for the future, including sustainable cities and AI’s role in building a better world.
